arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged into two series, one for materials relating to the Long Island Historical Society and one for other civic organizations in which North participated.

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: Edgerton G. North (1900–1967) was born in Brooklyn, where he worked as an appraiser. He was an active member in the community and assumed leadership roles in numerous civic groups and organizations, including the Long Island Historical Society, of which he was President from 1957 to 1965.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Edgerton G. North papers contain various records compiled by Edgerton G. North during his service as President of the Long Island Historical Society (later the Brooklyn Historical Society) from 1957 to 1965. The records document activities within the Long Island Historical Society and Mr. North's participation in six other civic organizations in Brooklyn between 1920 and 1962. The bulk of the records are from the 1950's and 1960's and include letters of correspondence, proposals, announcements, membership lists, board member lists, and minutes. The collection contains minutes for meetings held at the Long Island Historical Society, as well as the Brooklyn Central Branch Y.M.C.A., Brooklyn-Nassau Presbytery, Church of the Open Door, and the Downtown Area Renewal Effort, Inc.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series includes letters of correspondence, by-laws, reports, minutes, and other documents generated by and for the Long Island Historical Society (LIHS). The bulk dates of the series are from 1957 to 1960, but there are also five items dated from 1920 and 1921 regarding items loaned out by LIHS. Of particular interest are minutes for meetings held by LIHS in 1957; Articles for the Womens Committee of the Long Island Historical Society; a list of selected names from The Hundred Year Association of New York, Inc.; LIHS Librarian reports; LIHS library policies; and four booklets of Long Island Historical Society Certificate of Incorporation Articles of Association By-Laws, 1939.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Items in Series 1 are arranged chronologically in three legal-sized folders; one containing minutes, one containing items regarding the LIHS Library, and one containing other LIHS documents.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains correspondence, by-laws, reports, minutes, and other documents generated by and for the following civic organizations and dates: Brooklyn Central Branch Y.M.C.A., 1959 and undated; Brooklyn Heights Association, Inc., 1956-1962 and undated; Brooklyn-Nassau Presbytery, 1950-1962; Church of the Open Door, 1952-1957 and undated; Downtown Area Renewal Effort, Inc., 1956-1961; First Presbyterian Church of Brooklyn, 1960-1962.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The six folders in Series 2 are arranged alphabetically by organization name. Items in folders are arranged chronologically.
